title: Who was the shortest president in history? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hello, Ashwin—-I’m joking with you, but the shortest president I’m aware of was Benito Juarez, President of Mexico, who served from 1858 until 1872. He was also the first Mexican president of indigenous origin and was considered to be an able and highly competent leader. HE WAS ONLY 4 FEET, SIX INCHES but towered over others in accomplishments. If there were any more diminutive than Juarez somewhere in the world, I’m unaware of them. Now to answer the question I think you meant. The fifth president of the US was James Madison at 5’4.” Abraham Lincoln was the tallest at 6’3 3/4” in his stocking feet. With shoes and the tall stovepipe hat he wore, imagine how impressive he looked. In my opinion and that of many, Lincoln was tall in both physical and personal stature, meaning that his character and leadership skills were above many. Lyndon Baines Johnson was a tiny fraction of an inch shorter than Lincoln at 6’3 1/2 .” Thanks for asking, and I wish you a good day.
The shortest US president was James Madison at 5′4″. He was also a hypochondriac who drank a pint of whisky per day and lived to 85 years of age. The tallest was, of course, Abraham Lincoln at 6′4″
